meanings.sent1: I pressurize the bottle to make the ketchup come out faster.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic needs to pressurize the tires before the long road trip.
meanings.sent3: Trying to pressurize a balloon without popping it is quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to pressurize the room, making everyone feel uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The coach's intense stare seemed to pressurize the players to perform their best.

meanings.definition: To make a situation more intense or stressful (verb)
meanings.sent1: The upcoming exam will pressurize the students to study harder.
meanings.sent2: The tight deadline will pressurize the team to work efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The thought of having to bake a cake for the first time pressurized her into a frenzy.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the room seemed to pressurize the tension between them.
meanings.sent5: The storm approaching quickly began to pressurize the atmosphere with anticipation.
